summary: This is a transcript of a voluntary interview conducted by DOJ OIG Special Agents with a retired BOP Regional Director on October 13, 2021. The interview focuses on the circumstances surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's death at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in August 2019, including cellmate assignments, camera system failures, staff procedures, and the BOP's after-action report.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The high-profile inmate who died by suicide at MCC on August 10, 2019. The interview investigates the failures leading to his death.

persons.name: Tartaglione
persons.context: Epstein's cellmate during a July 23, 2019 incident where Epstein was found with a rope around his neck. Tartaglione claimed Epstein tried to hang himself.

persons.name: Efrain Reyes
persons.context: Epstein's cellmate after he was removed from suicide watch. Reyes was transferred/left the MCC on August 9, 2019, leaving Epstein without a cellmate.

connections.description: Were cellmates during a July 23, 2019 incident involving a possible assault or suicide attempt by Epstein.
Were cellmates after Epstein was removed from suicide watch. Reyes's departure left Epstein alone in his cell.

events.title: Epstein Incident with Cellmate Tartaglione
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found with a rope around his neck in his cell. He claimed assault by inmate Tartaglione; Tartaglione claimed Epstein tried to hang himself.

events.title: Epstein's Unmonitored Phone Call
events.description: Epstein was allowed to make a social phone call on an unmonitored legal line, claiming he wanted to call his deceased mother. The call was not logged or monitored.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at MCC at approximately 6:33 a.m. CPR was initiated. He was pronounced dead at 7:36 a.m. by an emergency room physician.

events.title: MCC Camera System Failure Noticed
events.description: MCC staff became aware that cameras in the SHU were not recording. The system had reportedly stopped recording on July 29. Replacement parts had been on site since October 2018 but were not installed.

events.title: Retirement of BOP Regional Director
events.description: The interviewee, a BOP Regional Director, retired from the Bureau of Prisons.

keyFacts: The retired BOP Regional Director had limited recollection of specific events from August 2019, citing the passage of time and the political nature of the Epstein investigation compared to other inmate suicides.
Key failures identified include: Epstein not being housed with a cellmate after Reyes left, and staff not conducting required rounds and counts on the night of August 9-10, 2019.
The MCC's camera system in the SHU was not recording prior to Epstein's death. Replacement parts had been on site for nearly a year but were not installed until after the incident.
Epstein made an unmonitored, unlogged social phone call on August 9, 2019, on a legal line, claiming he wanted to call his deceased mother. A man answered the phone.
The BOP's after-action report concluded that having a cellmate significantly lowers the odds of suicide, and a failure occurred by allowing Epstein to be in a cell alone.
